result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonte L Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Stipulated restitution for funeral/burial expenses in the amount of $6370.00 to Katherine B., joint and several with Eric Hill (14CF81).

Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition fo extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Original Transcript of SENTENCING (32 pages) commencing AUGUST 4, 2014, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Deonte L Hill in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Defendant Deonte L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Soutone P., Rubyt W., Sylvia W., Donna Y.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 210 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 9 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Stipulated restitution for funeral/burial expenses in the amount of $6370.00 to Katherine B., joint and several with Eric Hill (14CF81).
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Restitution paperwork received and filed.
Defense attorney requested sentencing date be changed.  DA approved, sentencing schedule for 08/04/2014 at 8:15am in Branch 38.

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court, defendant Deonte L Hill not in court, in custody.  Michael F Torphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Deonte L Hill in court by attorney Michael F Torphy who appears telephonically.  Defendant Deonte L Hill in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is advised that Atty Torphy has been retained to represent defendant.  The State is requesting an adjournment of the sentencing until after July 28.  Sentencing is adjourned to 7-31-2014 at 8:15am.
Copy of PSI is given to Atty Rupich to give to Atty Torphy with the consent of the Court.
for PSI

Defendant Deonte L Hill in court with attorney Robert Paul D'Arruda.  Defendant Deonte L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Letter of Resolution filed with the Court, signed by all parties.
Pursuant to negotiations, the REPEATER enhancer as to count 3 shall be deleted.
As to counts 4 and 5, the court will dismiss and read in for purposes of sentencing.
As to count 3 FELONY MURDER:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties are requesting a sentencing date after 5-12-2014.  The Court will order a PSI and remand the defendant and adjourn sentencing to 5-15-2014 at 8:15am.
The 4-21-2014 jury trial date is vacated.

Filed by the State:  Witness list; Notice of State's Intent to Present DNA Evidence at Trial and Notice of State's Intent to Present Expert Evidence at Trial; Motions in Limine; Requested Jury Instructions.
NOTE:  INCORRECT case number listed on documents.
